snippet: With its best-selling drugs losing patent protection, Pfizer is shedding money-making but noncore businesses to focus on pharmaceutical sciences.
abstract: Pfizer reports 19 percent profit decline, largely due to loss of sales of Lipitor, its best-selling drug, which lost patent protection in 2011; company reports earnings of $1.79 billion last quarter, or 24 cents a share, compared to $2.22 billion, or 28 cents a share over the same period last year.
lead_paragraph: With its best-selling drugs losing patent protection, Pfizer is shedding money-making but noncore businesses to focus on pharmaceutical sciences.

headline.seo: Pfizer Profit Declines 19% After Loss of Lipitor Patent
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Profit Declines 19% On Slumping Lipitor Sales
